verses.textEn: For I was hungry, and you did not give me to eat; I was thirsty, and you did not give me to drink;
verses.textLa: Esurivi enim, et non dedistis mihi manducare: sitivi, et non desistis mihi potum:

verses.textEn: I was a stranger and you did not take me in; naked, and you did not cover me; sick and in prison, and you did not visit me.’
verses.textLa: hospes eram, et non collegistis me: nudus, et non cooperuistis me: infirmus, et in carcere, et non visitastis me.

verses.textEn: Then they will also answer him, saying: ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister to you?’
verses.textLa: Tunc respondebunt ei et ipsi, dicentes: Domine, quando te vidimus esurientem, aut sitientem, aut hospitem, aut nudum, aut infirmum, aut in carcere, et non ministravimus tibi?

verses.textEn: Then he shall respond to them by saying: ‘Amen I say to you, whenever you did not do it to one of these least, neither did you do it to me.’
verses.textLa: Tunc respondebit illis dicens: Amen dico vobis: Quamdiu non fecistis uni de minoribus his, nec mihi fecistis.

verses.textEn: And these shall go into eternal punishment, but the just shall go into eternal life.”
verses.textLa: Et ibunt hi in supplicium æternum: iusti autem in vitam æternam.

verses.textEn: And it happened that, when Jesus had completed all these words, he said to his disciples,
verses.textLa: Et factum est: cum consummasset Iesus sermones hos omnes, dixit discipulis suis:

verses.textEn: “You know that after two days the Passover will begin, and the Son of man will be handed over to be crucified.”
verses.textLa: Scitis quia post biduum Pascha fiet, et Filius hominis tradetur ut crucifigatur.

verses.textEn: Then the leaders of the priests and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas.
verses.textLa: Tunc congregati sunt principes sacerdotum, et seniores populi in atrium principis sacerdotum, qui dicebatur Caiphas:

verses.textEn: And they took counsel so that by deceitfulness they might take hold of Jesus and kill him.
verses.textLa: et consilium fecerunt ut Iesum dolo tenerent, et occiderent.

verses.textEn: But they said, “Not on the feast day, lest perhaps there may be a tumult among the people.”
verses.textLa: Dicebant autem: Non in die festo, ne forte tumultus fieret in populo.

verses.textEn: And when Jesus was in Bethania, in the house of Simon the leper,
verses.textLa: Cum autem Iesus esset in Bethania in domo Simonis leprosi,

verses.textEn: a woman drew near to him, holding an alabaster box of precious ointment, and she poured it over his head while he was reclining at table.
verses.textLa: accessit ad eum mulier habens alabastrum unguenti pretiosi, et effudit super caput ipsius recumbentis.

verses.textEn: But the disciples, seeing this, were indignant, saying: “What is the purpose of this waste?
verses.textLa: Videntes autem discipuli, indignati sunt dicentes: Ut quid perditio hæc?

verses.textEn: For this could have been sold for a great deal, so as to be given to the poor.”
verses.textLa: potuit enim istud venundari multo, et dari pauperibus.

verses.textEn: But Jesus, knowing this, said to them: “Why are you bothering this woman? For she has done a good deed to me.
verses.textLa: Sciens autem Iesus, ait illis: Quid molesti estis huic mulieri? Opus enim bonum operata est in me.

verses.textEn: For the poor you will always have with you. But you will not always have me.
verses.textLa: Nam semper pauperes habetis vobiscum: me autem non semper habetis.

verses.textEn: For in pouring this ointment on my body, she has prepared for my burial.
verses.textLa: Mittens enim hæc unguentum hoc in corpus meum: ad sepeliendum me fecit.

verses.textEn: Amen I say to you, wherever this Gospel will be preached in the whole world, what she has done also shall be told, in memory of her.”
verses.textLa: Amen dico vobis, ubicumque prædicatum fuerit hoc Evangelium in toto mundo, dicetur et quod hæc fecit in memoriam eius.

verses.textEn: Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went to the leaders of the priests,
verses.textLa: Tunc abiit unus de duodecim, qui dicebatur Iudas Iscariotes, ad principes sacerdotum:

verses.textEn: and he said to them, “What are you willing to give me, if I hand him over to you?” So they appointed thirty pieces of silver for him.
verses.textLa: et ait illis: Quid vultis mihi dare, et ego vobis eum tradam? At illi constituerunt ei triginta argenteos.

verses.textEn: And from then on, he sought an opportunity to betray him.
verses.textLa: Et exinde quærebat opportunitatem ut eum traderet.

verses.textEn: Then, on the first day of Unleavened Bread, the disciples approached Jesus, saying, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”
verses.textLa: Prima autem die Azymorum accesserunt discipuli ad Iesum, dicentes: Ubi vis paremus tibi comedere Pascha?

verses.textEn: So Jesus said, “Go into the city, to a certain one, and say to him: ‘The Teacher said: My time is near. I am observing the Passover with you, along with my disciples.’ ”
verses.textLa: At Iesus dixit: Ite in civitatem ad quemdam, et dicite ei: Magister dicit: Tempus meum prope est, apud te facio Pascha cum discipulis meis.

verses.textEn: And the disciples did just as Jesus appointed to them. And they prepared the Passover.
verses.textLa: Et fecerunt discipuli sicut constituit illis Iesus, et paraverunt Pascha.

verses.textEn: Then, when evening arrived, he sat at table with his twelve disciples.
verses.textLa: Vespere autem facto, discumbebat cum duodecim discipulis suis.

verses.textEn: And while they were eating, he said: “Amen I say to you, that one of you is about to betray me.”
verses.textLa: Et edentibus illis, dixit: Amen dico vobis, quia unus vestrum me traditurus est.

verses.textEn: And being greatly saddened, each one of them began to say, “Surely, it is not I, Lord?”
verses.textLa: Et contristati valde, cœperunt singuli dicere: Numquid ego sum Domine?
verses.notes: The word ‘Numquid’ indicates a question that expects a negative answer; but it is still a question. Therefore, each disciple was not saying, ‘It is not I who will betray you,’ nor was each asking for information as to whether they were the one who would betray him, as in ‘Who is it that will betray you; is it me?’ Rather, it is a rhetorical question, but with some doubt, as in: ‘It cannot be me who will betray you, can it?’

verses.textEn: But he responded by saying: “He who dips his hand with me into the dish, the same will betray me.
verses.textLa: At ipse respondens, ait: Qui intingit mecum manum in paropside, hic me tradet.

verses.textEn: Indeed, the Son of man goes, just as it has been written about him. But woe to that man by whom the Son of man will be betrayed. It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”
verses.textLa: Filius quidem hominis vadit, sicut scriptum est de illo: væ autem homini illi, per quem Filius hominis tradetur: bonum erat ei, si natus non fuisset homo ille.

verses.textEn: Then Judas, who betrayed him, responded by saying, “Surely, it is not I, Master?” He said to him, “You have said it.”
verses.textLa: Respondens autem Iudas, qui tradidit eum, dixit: Numquid ego sum Rabbi? Ait illi: Tu dixisti.

verses.textEn: Now while they were eating the meal, Jesus took bread, and he blessed and broke and gave it to his disciples, and he said: “Take and eat. This is my body.”
verses.textLa: Cœnantibus autem eis, accepit Iesus panem, et benedixit, ac fregit, deditque discipulis suis, et ait: Accipite, et comedite: hoc est corpus meum.

verses.textEn: And taking the chalice, he gave thanks. And he gave it to them, saying: “Drink from this, all of you.
verses.textLa: Et accipiens calicem gratias egit: et dedit illis, dicens: Bibite ex hoc omnes.

verses.textEn: For this is my blood of the new covenant, which shall be shed for many as a remission of sins.
verses.textLa: Hic est enim sanguis meus Novi Testamenti, qui pro multis effundetur in remissionem peccatorum.

verses.textEn: But I say to you, I will not drink again from this fruit of the vine, until that day when I will drink it new with you in the kingdom of my Father.”
verses.textLa: Dico autem vobis: non bibam amodo de hoc genimine vitis usque in diem illum, cum illud bibam vobiscum novum in regno Patris mei.

verses.textEn: And after a hymn was sung, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.textLa: Et hymno dicto, exierunt in Montem Oliveti.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus said to them: “You will all fall away from me in this night. For it has been written: ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’
verses.textLa: Tunc dicit illis Iesus: Omnes vos scandalum patiemini in me, in ista nocte. Scriptum est enim: Percutiam pastorem, et dispergentur oves gregis.

verses.textEn: But after I have risen again, I will go before you to Galilee.”
verses.textLa: Postquam autem resurrexero, præcedam vos in Galilæam.

verses.textEn: Then Peter responded by saying to him, “Even if everyone else has fallen away from you, I will never fall away.”
verses.textLa: Respondens autem Petrus, ait illi: Et si omnes scandalizati fuerint in te, ego numquam scandalizabor.

verses.textEn: Jesus said to him, “Amen I say to you, that in this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.”
verses.textLa: Ait illi Iesus: Amen dico tibi, quia in hac nocte, antequam gallus cantet, ter me negabis.

verses.textEn: Peter said to him, “Even if it is necessary for me to die with you, I will not deny you.” And all the disciples spoke similarly.
verses.textLa: Ait illi Petrus: Etiamsi oportuerit me mori tecum, non te negabo. Similiter et omnes discipuli dixerunt.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus went with them to a garden, which is called Gethsemani. And he said to his disciples, “Sit down here, while I go there and pray.”
verses.textLa: Tunc venit Iesus cum illis in villam, quæ dicitur Gethsemani, et dixit discipulis suis: Sedete hic donec vadam illuc, et orem.

verses.textEn: And taking with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to be sorrowful and saddened.
verses.textLa: Et assumpto Petro, et duobus filiis Zebedæi, cœpit contristari et mœstus esse.

verses.textEn: Then he said to them: “My soul is sorrowful, even unto death. Stay here and keep vigil with me.”
verses.textLa: Tunc ait illis: Tristis est anima mea usque ad mortem: sustinete hic, et vigilate mecum.

verses.textEn: And continuing on a little further, he fell prostrate on his face, praying and saying: “My Father, if it is possible, let this chalice pass away from me. Yet truly, let it not be as I will, but as you will.”
verses.textLa: Et progressus pusillum, procidit in faciem suam, orans, et dicens: Pater mi, si possibile est, transeat a me calix iste. Verumtamen non sicut ego volo, sed sicut tu.

verses.textEn: And he approached his disciples and found them sleeping. And he said to Peter: “So, were you not able to keep vigil with me for one hour?
verses.textLa: Et venit ad discipulos suos, et invenit eos dormientes, et dicit Petro: Sic non potuistis una hora vigilare mecum?

verses.textEn: Be vigilant and pray, so that you may not enter into temptation. Indeed, the spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.textLa: Vigilate, et orate ut non intretis in tentationem. Spiritus quidem promptus est, caro autem infirma.

verses.textEn: Again, a second time, he went and prayed, saying, “My Father, if this chalice cannot pass away, unless I drink it, let your will be done.”
verses.textLa: Iterum secundo abiit, et oravit, dicens: Pater mi, si non potest hic calix transire nisi bibam illum, fiat voluntas tua.

verses.textEn: And again, he went and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.
verses.textLa: Et venit iterum, et invenit eos dormientes: erant enim oculi eorum gravati.

verses.textEn: And leaving them behind, again he went and prayed for the third time, saying the same words.
verses.textLa: Et relictis illis, iterum abiit, et oravit tertio, eumdem sermonem dicens.

verses.textEn: Then he approached his disciples and said to them: “Sleep now and rest. Behold, the hour has drawn near, and the Son of man will be delivered into the hands of sinners.
verses.textLa: Tunc venit ad discipulos suos, et dicit illis: Dormite iam, et requiescite: ecce appropinquavit hora, et Filius hominis tradetur in manus peccatorum.

verses.textEn: Rise up; let us go. Behold, he who will betray me draws near.”
verses.textLa: Surgite eamus: ecce appropinquavit qui me tradet.

verses.textEn: While he was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived, and with him was a large crowd with swords and clubs, sent from the leaders of the priests and the elders of the people.
verses.textLa: Adhuc eo loquente, ecce Iudas unus de duodecim venit, et cum eo turba multa cum gladiis, et fustibus, missi a principibus sacerdotum, et senioribus populi.

verses.textEn: And he who betrayed him gave them a sign, saying: “Whomever I will kiss, it is he. Take hold of him.”
verses.textLa: Qui autem tradidit eum, dedit illis signum, dicens: Quemcumque osculatus fuero, ipse est, tenete eum.

verses.textEn: And quickly drawing close to Jesus, he said, “Hail, Master.” And he kissed him.
verses.textLa: Et confestim accedens ad Iesum, dixit: Ave Rabbi. Et osculatus est eum.

verses.textEn: And Jesus said to him, “Friend, for what purpose have you come?” Then they approached, and they put their hands on Jesus, and they held him.
verses.textLa: Dixitque illi Iesus: Amice, ad quid venisti? Tunc accesserunt, et manus iniecerunt in Iesum, et tenuerunt eum.

verses.textEn: And behold, one of those who were with Jesus, extending his hand, drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
verses.textLa: Et ecce unus ex his, qui erant cum Iesu, extendens manum, exemit gladium suum, et percutiens servum principis sacerdotum amputavit auriculam eius.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus said to him: “Put your sword back in its place. For all who take up the sword shall perish by the sword.
verses.textLa: Tunc ait illi Iesus: Converte gladium tuum in locum suum. Omnes enim, qui acceperint gladium, gladio peribunt.

verses.textEn: Or do you think that I cannot ask my Father, so that he would give me, even now, more than twelve legions of Angels?
verses.textLa: An putas, quia non possum rogare Patrem meum, et exhibebit mihi modo plusquam duodecim legiones angelorum?

verses.textEn: How then would the Scriptures be fulfilled, which say that it must be so?”
verses.textLa: Quomodo ergo implebuntur Scripturæ, quia sic oportet fieri?

verses.textEn: In that same hour, Jesus said to the crowds: “You went out, as if to a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me. Yet I sat daily with you, teaching in the temple, and you did not take hold of me.
verses.textLa: In illa hora dixit Iesus turbis: Tamquam ad latronem existis cum gladiis, et fustibus comprehendere me: quotidie apud vos sedebam docens in templo, et non me tenuistis.

verses.textEn: But all this has happened so that the Scriptures of the prophets may be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples fled, abandoning him.
verses.textLa: Hoc autem totum factum est, ut adimplerentur Scripturæ prophetarum. Tunc discipuli omnes, relicto eo, fugerunt.

verses.textEn: But those who were holding Jesus led him to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and the elders had joined together.
verses.textLa: At illi tenentes Iesum, duxerunt ad Caipham principem sacerdotum, ubi Scribæ et seniores convenerant.

verses.textEn: Then Peter followed him from a distance, as far as the court of the high priest. And going inside, he sat down with the servants, so that he might see the end.
verses.textLa: Petrus autem sequebatur eum a longe, usque in atrium principis sacerdotum. Et ingressus intro, sedebat cum ministris, ut videret finem.

verses.textEn: Then the leaders of the priests and the entire council sought false testimony against Jesus, so that they might deliver him to death.
verses.textLa: Principes autem sacerdotum, et omne concilium quærebant falsum testimonium contra Iesum, ut eum morti traderent:

verses.textEn: And they did not find any, even though many false witnesses had come forward. Then, at the very end, two false witnesses came forward,
verses.textLa: et non invenerunt, cum multi falsi testes accessissent. Novissime autem venerunt duo falsi testes,

verses.textEn: and they said, “This man said: ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God, and, after three days, to rebuild it.’ ”
verses.textLa: et dixerunt: Hic dixit: Possum destruere templum Dei, et post triduum reædificare illud.

verses.textEn: And the high priest, rising up, said to him, “Have you nothing to respond to what these ones testify against you?”
verses.textLa: Et surgens princeps sacerdotum, ait illi: Nihil respondes ad ea, quæ isti adversum te testificantur?

verses.textEn: But Jesus was silent. And the high priest said to him, “I bind you by an oath to the living God to tell us if you are the Christ, the Son of God.”
verses.textLa: Iesus autem tacebat. Et princeps sacerdotum ait illi: Adiuro te per Deum vivum, ut dicas nobis si tu es Christus Filius Dei.

verses.textEn: Jesus said to him: “You have said it. Yet truly I say to you, hereafter you shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of the power of God, and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.textLa: Dicit illi Iesus: Tu dixisti. Verumtamen dico vobis, amodo videbitis Filium hominis sedentem a dextris virtutis Dei, et venientem in nubibus cæli.

verses.textEn: Then the high priest tore his garments, saying: “He has blasphemed. Why do we still need witnesses? Behold, you have now heard the blasphemy.
verses.textLa: Tunc princeps sacerdotum scidit vestimenta sua, dicens: Blasphemavit: quid adhuc egemus testibus? Ecce nunc audistis blasphemiam:

verses.textEn: How does it seem to you?” So they responded by saying, “He is guilty unto death.”
verses.textLa: Quid vobis videtur? At illi respondentes dixerunt: Reus est mortis.

verses.textEn: Then they spit in his face, and they struck him with fists. And others struck his face with the palms of their hands,
verses.textLa: Tunc expuerunt in faciem eius, et colaphis eum ceciderunt, alii autem palmas in faciem eius dederunt,

verses.textEn: saying: “Prophesy for us, O Christ. Who is the one that struck you?”
verses.textLa: dicentes: Prophetiza nobis Christe, quis est qui te percussit?

verses.textEn: Yet truly, Peter sat outside in the courtyard. And a maidservant approached him, saying, “You also were with Jesus the Galilean.”
verses.textLa: Petrus vero sedebat foris in atrio: et accessit ad eum una ancilla, dicens: Et tu cum Iesu Galilæo eras.

verses.textEn: But he denied it in the sight of them all, saying, “I do not know what you are saying.”
verses.textLa: At ille negavit coram omnibus, dicens: Nescio quid dicis.

verses.textEn: Then, as he exited by the gate, another maidservant saw him. And she said to those who were there, “This man also was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.textLa: Exeunte autem illo ianuam, vidit eum alia ancilla, et ait his, qui erant ibi: Et hic erat cum Iesu Nazareno.

verses.textEn: And again, he denied it with an oath, “For I do not know the man.”
verses.textLa: Et iterum negavit cum iuramento: Quia non novi hominem.

verses.textEn: And after a little while, those who were standing nearby came and said to Peter: “Truly, you also are one of them. For even your manner of speaking reveals you.”
verses.textLa: Et post pusillum accesserunt qui stabant, et dixerunt Petro: Vere et tu ex illis es: nam et loquela tua manifestum te facit.

verses.textEn: Then he began to curse and to swear that he had not known the man. And immediately the rooster crowed.
verses.textLa: Tunc cœpit detestari, et iurare quia non novisset hominem. Et continuo gallus cantavit.

verses.textEn: And Peter remembered the words of Jesus, which he had said: “Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.” And going outside, he wept bitterly.
verses.textLa: Et recordatus est Petrus verbi Iesu, quod dixerat: Prius quam gallus cantet, ter me negabis. Et egressus foras, flevit amare.

verses.textEn: Then, when morning arrived, all the leaders of the priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus, so that they might deliver him to death.
verses.textLa: Mane autem facto, consilium inierunt omnes principes sacerdotum, et seniores populi adversus Iesum, ut eum morti traderent.

verses.textEn: And they led him, bound, and handed him over to Pontius Pilate, the procurator.
verses.textLa: Et vinctum adduxerunt eum, et tradiderunt Pontio Pilato præsidi.

verses.textEn: Then Judas, who betrayed him, seeing that he had been condemned, regretting his conduct, brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the leaders of the priests and the elders,
verses.textLa: Tunc videns Iudas, qui eum tradidit, quod damnatus esset; pœnitentia ductus, retulit triginta argenteos principibus sacerdotum, et senioribus,
verses.notes: In my theological opinion, Judas truly repented from his betrayal of Christ. Therefore, the salvation of those who go to Heaven is not dependent on Judas having been sent to Hell. Yet Judas next despaired of the Mercy of God, killing himself. Therefore, he went to Hell for the latter sin, not for the former sin.

verses.textEn: saying, “I have sinned in betraying just blood.” But they said to him: “What is that to us? See to it yourself.”
verses.textLa: dicens: Peccavi, tradens sanguinem iustum. At illi dixerunt: Quid ad nos? tu videris.

verses.textEn: And throwing down the pieces of silver in the temple, he departed. And going out, he hanged himself with a snare.
verses.textLa: Et proiectis argenteis in templo, recessit: et abiens laqueo se suspendit.

verses.textEn: But the leaders of the priests, having taken up the pieces of silver, said, “It is not lawful to put them into the temple offerings, because it is the price of blood.”
verses.textLa: Principes autem sacerdotum, acceptis argenteis, dixerunt: Non licet eos mittere in corbonam: quia pretium sanguinis est.

verses.textEn: Then, having taken counsel, they bought the potter’s field with it, as a burying place for sojourners.
verses.textLa: Consilio autem inito, emerunt ex illis agrum figuli, in sepulturam peregrinorum.

verses.textEn: For this reason, that field is called Haceldama, that is, ‘The Field of Blood,’ even to this very day.
verses.textLa: Propter hoc vocatus est ager ille, Haceldama, hoc est, ager sanguinis, usque in hodiernum diem.

verses.textEn: Then what was spoken by the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled, saying, “And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the one being appraised, whom they appraised before the sons of Israel,
verses.textLa: Tunc impletum est quod dictum est per Ieremiam prophetam, dicentem: Et acceperunt triginta argenteos pretium appretiati, quem appretiaverunt a filiis Israel:

verses.textEn: and they gave it for the potter’s field, just as the Lord appointed to me.”
verses.textLa: et dederunt eos in agrum figuli, sicut constituit mihi Dominus.

verses.textEn: Now Jesus stood before the procurator, and the procurator questioned him, saying, “You are the king of the Jews?” Jesus said to him, “You are saying so.”
verses.textLa: Iesus autem stetit ante præsidem, et interrogavit eum præses, dicens: Tu es rex Iudæorum? Dicit illi Iesus: Tu dicis.

verses.textEn: And when he was accused by the leaders of the priests and the elders, he responded nothing.
verses.textLa: Et cum accusaretur a principibus sacerdotum, et senioribus, nihil respondit.

verses.textEn: Then Pilate said to him, “Do you not hear how much testimony they speak against you?”
verses.textLa: Tunc dicit illi Pilatus: Non audis quanta adversum te dicunt testimonia?

verses.textEn: And he did not respond any word to him, so that the procurator wondered greatly.
verses.textLa: Et non respondit ei ad ullum verbum, ita ut miraretur præses vehementer.

verses.textEn: Now on the solemn day, the procurator was accustomed to release to the people one prisoner, whomever they wished.
verses.textLa: Per diem autem sollemnem consueverat præses populi dimittere unum vinctum, quem voluissent.

verses.textEn: And at that time, he had a notorious prisoner, who was called Barabbas.
verses.textLa: Habebat autem tunc vinctum insignem, qui dicebatur Barrabas.

verses.textEn: Therefore, having been gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Who is it that you want me to release to you: Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ?”
verses.textLa: Congregatis ergo illis dixit Pilatus: Quem vultis dimittam vobis: Barabbam, an Iesum, qui dicitur Christus?

verses.textEn: For he knew that it was out of envy they had handed him over.
verses.textLa: Sciebat enim quod per invidiam tradidissent eum.

verses.textEn: But as he was sitting in the place for the tribunal, his wife sent to him, saying: “It is nothing to you, and he is just. For I have experienced many things today through a vision for his sake.”
verses.textLa: Sedente autem illo pro tribunali, misit ad eum uxor eius, dicens: Nihil tibi, et iusto illi. Multa enim passa sum hodie per visum propter eum.
verses.notes: The text in Latin does not say any word referring to a dream. The word ‘visum’ means vision. Also, she says ‘today,’ not ‘in the night,’ and there is no reference to sleep. Compare this to other references in Scripture about dreams versus visions. It is clear that this was a vision, not a dream.

verses.textEn: But the leaders of the priests and the elders persuaded the people, so that they would ask for Barabbas, and so that Jesus would perish.
verses.textLa: Principes autem sacerdotum, et seniores persuaserunt populis ut peterent Barabbam, Iesum vero perderent.

verses.textEn: Then, in response, the procurator said to them, “Which of the two do you want to be released to you?” But they said to him, “Barabbas.”
verses.textLa: Respondens autem præses, ait illis: Quem vultis vobis de duobus dimitti? At illi dixerunt: Barabbam.

verses.textEn: Pilate said to them, “Then what shall I do about Jesus, who is called Christ?” They all said, “Let him be crucified.”
verses.textLa: Dicit illis Pilatus: Quid igitur faciam de Iesu, qui dicitur Christus? Dicunt omnes: Crucifigatur.

verses.textEn: The procurator said to them, “But what evil has he done?” But they cried out all the more, saying, “Let him be crucified.”
verses.textLa: Ait illis præses: Quid enim mali fecit? At illi magis clamabant dicentes: Crucifigatur.

verses.textEn: Then Pilate, seeing that he was able to accomplish nothing, but that a greater tumult was occurring, taking water, washed his hands in the sight of the people, saying: “I am innocent of the blood of this just man. See to it yourselves.”
verses.textLa: Videns autem Pilatus quia nihil proficeret, sed magis tumultus fieret: accepta aqua, lavit manus coram populo, dicens: Innocens ego sum a sanguine iusti huius: vos videritis.

verses.textEn: And the entire people responded by saying, “May his blood be upon us and upon our children.”
verses.textLa: Et respondens universus populus, dixit: Sanguis eius super nos, et super filios nostros.

verses.textEn: Then he released Barabbas to them. But Jesus, having been scourged, he handed over to them, so that he would be crucified.
verses.textLa: Tunc dimisit illis Barabbam: Iesum autem flagellatum tradidit eis ut crucifigeretur.

verses.textEn: Then the soldiers of the procurator, taking Jesus up to the praetorium, gathered the entire cohort around him.
verses.textLa: Tunc milites præsidis suscipientes Iesum in prætorium, congregaverunt ad eum universam cohortem:

verses.textEn: And stripping him, they put a scarlet cloak around him.
verses.textLa: et exuentes eum, chlamydem coccineam circumdederunt ei,

verses.textEn: And plaiting a crown of thorns, they placed it on his head, with a reed in his right hand. And genuflecting before him, they mocked him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews.”
verses.textLa: et plectentes coronam de spinis, posuerunt super caput eius, et arundinem in dextera eius. Et genu flexo ante eum, illudebant ei, dicentes: Ave Rex Iudæorum.

verses.textEn: And spitting on him, they took the reed and struck his head.
verses.textLa: Et expuentes in eum, acceperunt arundinem, et percutiebant caput eius.

verses.textEn: And after they had mocked him, they stripped him of the cloak, and clothed him with his own garments, and they led him away to crucify him.
verses.textLa: Et postquam illuserunt ei, exuerunt eum chlamyde, et induerunt eum vestimentis eius, et duxerunt eum ut crucifigerent.

verses.textEn: But as they were going out, they came upon a man of Cyrene, named Simon, whom they compelled to take up his cross.
verses.textLa: Exeuntes autem invenerunt hominem Cyrenæum, nomine Simonem: hunc angariaverunt ut tolleret crucem eius.

verses.textEn: And they arrived at the place which is called Golgotha, which is the place of Calvary.
verses.textLa: Et venerunt in locum, qui dicitur Golgotha, quod est Calvariæ locus.

verses.textEn: And they gave him wine to drink, mixed with gall. And when he had tasted it, he refused to drink it.
verses.textLa: Et dederunt ei vinum bibere cum felle mistum. Et cum gustasset, noluit bibere.

verses.textEn: Then, after they had crucified him, they divided his garments, casting lots, in order to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet, saying: “They divided my garments among them, and over my vestment they cast lots.”
verses.textLa: Postquam autem crucifixerunt eum, diviserunt vestimenta eius, sortem mittentes: ut impleretur quod dictum est per prophetam dicentem: Diviserunt sibi vestimenta mea, et super vestem meam miserunt sortem.

verses.textEn: And sitting down, they observed him.
verses.textLa: Et sedentes servabant eum.

verses.textEn: And they set his accusation above his head, written as: THIS IS JESUS, KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.textLa: Et imposuerunt super caput eius causam ipsius scriptam: HIC EST IESUS REX IUDÆORUM.

verses.textEn: Then two robbers were crucified with him: one on the right and one on the left.
verses.textLa: Tunc crucifixi sunt cum eo duo latrones: unus a dextris, et unus a sinistris.
verses.notes: The word ‘latrones’ in Latin specifically refers to robbers, not to thieves.

verses.textEn: But those passing by blasphemed him, shaking their heads,
verses.textLa: Prætereuntes autem blasphemabant eum moventes capita sua,

verses.textEn: and saying: “Ah, so you would destroy the temple of God and in three days rebuild it! Save your own self. If you are the Son of God, descend from the cross.”
verses.textLa: et dicentes: Vah qui destruis templum Dei, et in triduo illud reædificas: salva temetipsum: si Filius Dei es, descende de cruce.

verses.textEn: And similarly, the leaders of the priests, with the scribes and the elders, mocking him, said:
verses.textLa: Similiter et principes sacerdotum illudentes cum Scribis, et senioribus dicebant:

verses.textEn: “He saved others; he cannot save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him descend now from the cross, and we will believe in him.
verses.textLa: Alios salvos fecit, seipsum non potest salvum facere: si Rex Israel est, descendat nunc de cruce, et credimus ei:

verses.textEn: He trusted in God; so now, let God free him, if he wills him. For he said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”
verses.textLa: confidit in Deo: liberet nunc, si vult eum: dixit enim: Quia Filius Dei sum.
verses.notes: Literally the text says “for he said ‘that I am the Son of God’ ” Quotations were written differently in that time period than they are today. We would say either, “for he said that he is the Son of God,” or, “for he said: ‘I am the Son of God.’ ” But the text has something of a combination of those two approaches.

verses.textEn: Then, the robbers who were crucified with him also reproached him with the very same thing.
verses.textLa: Idipsum autem et latrones, qui crucifixi erant cum eo, improperabant ei.

verses.textEn: Now from the sixth hour, there was darkness over the entire earth, even until the ninth hour.
verses.textLa: A sexta autem hora tenebræ factæ sunt super universam terram usque ad horam nonam.

verses.textEn: And about the ninth hour, Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying: “Eli, Eli, lamma sabacthani?” that is, “My God, My God, why have you forsaken me?”
verses.textLa: Et circa horam nonam clamavit Iesus voce magna, dicens: Eli, Eli, lamma sabacthani? hoc est: Deus meus, Deus meus ut quid dereliquisti me?

verses.textEn: Then certain ones who were standing and listening there said, “This man calls upon Elijah.”
verses.textLa: Quidam autem illic stantes, et audientes, dicebant: Eliam vocat iste.

verses.textEn: And one of them, running quickly, took a sponge and filled it with vinegar, and he set it on a reed and he gave it to him to drink.
verses.textLa: Et continuo currens unus ex eis acceptam spongiam implevit aceto, et imposuit arundini, et dabat ei bibere.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the others said, “Wait. Let us see whether Elijah will come to free him.”
verses.textLa: Ceteri vero dicebant: Sine videamus an veniat Elias liberans eum.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus, crying out again with a loud voice, gave up his life.
verses.textLa: Iesus autem iterum clamans voce magna, emisit spiritum.
verses.notes: Correct translations of this last phrase would include: ‘he gave up his spirit,’ ‘he breathed his last breath,’ ‘he gave up his life,’ ‘he uttered his last breath,’ and other phrasings. But a very literal translation of this particular phrase would be misleading: ‘he sent out the spirit.’

verses.textEn: And behold, the veil of the temple was torn into two parts, from top to bottom. And the earth was shaken, and the rocks were split apart.
verses.textLa: Et ecce velum templi scissum est in duas partes a summo usque deorsum. Et terra mota est, et petræ scissæ sunt,

verses.textEn: And the tombs were opened. And many bodies of the saints, which had been sleeping, arose.
verses.textLa: et monumenta aperta sunt: et multa corpora sanctorum, qui dormierant, surrexerunt.

verses.textEn: And going out from the tombs, after his resurrection, they went into the holy city, and they appeared to many.
verses.textLa: Et exeuntes de monumentis post resurrectionem eius, venerunt in sanctam civitatem, et apparuerunt multis.

verses.textEn: Now the centurion and those who were with him, guarding Jesus, having seen the earthquake and the things that were done, were very fearful, saying: “Truly, this was the Son of God.”
verses.textLa: Centurio autem, et qui cum eo erant, custodientes Iesum, viso terræmotu et his, quæ fiebant, timuerunt valde, dicentes: Vere Filius Dei erat iste.

verses.textEn: And in that place, there were many women, at a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering to him.
verses.textLa: Erant autem ibi mulieres multæ a longe, quæ secutæ erant Iesum a Galilæa, ministrantes ei:

verses.textEn: Among these were Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
verses.textLa: inter quas erat Maria Magdalene, et Maria Iacobi, et Ioseph mater, et mater filiorum Zebedæi.

verses.textEn: Then, when evening had arrived, a certain wealthy man from Arimathea, named Joseph, arrived, who himself was also a disciple of Jesus.
verses.textLa: Cum autem sero factum esset, venit quidam homo dives ab Arimathæa, nomine Ioseph, qui et ipse discipulus erat Iesu.

verses.textEn: This man approached Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate ordered the body to be released.
verses.textLa: Hic accessit ad Pilatum, et petiit corpus Iesu. Tunc Pilatus iussit reddi corpus.

verses.textEn: And Joseph, taking the body, wrapped it in a clean finely-woven linen cloth,
verses.textLa: Et accepto corpore, Ioseph involvit illud in sindone munda.

verses.textEn: and he placed it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out of a rock. And he rolled a great stone to the door of the tomb, and he went away.
verses.textLa: Et posuit illud in monumento suo novo, quod exciderat in petra. Et advolvit saxum magnum ad ostium monumenti, et abiit.

verses.textEn: Now Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were there, sitting opposite the sepulcher.
verses.textLa: Erant autem ibi Maria Magdalene, et altera Maria, sedentes contra sepulchrum.

verses.textEn: Then the next day, which is after the Preparation day, the leaders of the priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate together,
verses.textLa: Altera autem die, quæ est post Parasceven, convenerunt principes sacerdotum et Pharisæi ad Pilatum,

verses.textEn: saying: “Lord, we have remembered that this seducer said, while he was still alive, ‘After three days, I will rise again.’
verses.textLa: dicentes: Domine, recordati sumus, quia seductor ille dixit adhuc vivens: Post tres dies resurgam.

verses.textEn: Therefore, order the sepulcher to be guarded until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples may come and steal him, and say to the people, ‘He has risen from the dead.’ And this last error would be worse than the first.”
verses.textLa: Iube ergo custodiri sepulchrum usque in diem tertium: ne forte veniant discipuli eius, et furentur eum, et dicant plebi: Surrexit a mortuis: et erit novissimus error peior priore.

verses.textEn: Pilate said to them: “You have a guard. Go, guard it as you know how.”
verses.textLa: Ait illis Pilatus: Habetis custodiam, ite, custodite sicut scitis.

verses.textEn: Then, going out, they secured the sepulcher with guards, sealing the stone.
verses.textLa: Illi autem abeuntes, munierunt sepulchrum, signantes lapidem, cum custodibus.

verses.textEn: Now on the morning of the Sabbath, when it began to grow light on the first Sabbath, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to see the sepulcher.
verses.textLa: Vespere autem Sabbati, quæ lucescit in prima Sabbati, venit Maria Magdalene, et altera Maria videre sepulchrum.
verses.notes:
The two Marys set out at first light, but before the sun rose over the horizon. This period of time is similar to the time after sunset, when it is not yet dark. The length of this time is approximately an hour. Although the word ‘evening’ is used very broadly today, it specifically refers to that period of time between sunset and darkness, or, as in this case, between darkness and sunrise. So the two Marys set out at evening, that is, at first light in the morning, but before sunrise. The translation avoids this confusion of terms by using morning, instead of evening.
 Notice that Matthew, after the Crucifixion, begins to count Sunday, the day of the Resurrection, as the Sabbath. Whereas, elsewhere in his Gospel, he counts Saturday as the Sabbath. He also states that this day is the first (Christian) Sabbath.

verses.textEn: And behold, a great earthquake occurred. For an Angel of the Lord descended from heaven, and as he approached, he rolled back the stone and sat down on it.
verses.textLa: Et ecce terræmotus factus est magnus. Angelus enim Domini descendit de cælo: et accedens revolvit lapidem, et sedebat super eum:

verses.textEn: Now his appearance was like lightning, and his vestment was like snow.
verses.textLa: erat autem aspectus eius sicut fulgur: et vestimentum eius sicut nix.

verses.textEn: Then, out of fear of him, the guards were terrified, and they became like dead men.
verses.textLa: Præ timore autem eius exterriti sunt custodes, et facti sunt velut mortui.

verses.textEn: Then the Angel responded by saying to the women: “Do not be afraid. For I know that you are seeking Jesus, who was crucified.
verses.textLa: Respondens autem Angelus dixit mulieribus: Nolite timere vos: scio enim, quod Iesum, qui crucifixus est, quæritis.

verses.textEn: He is not here. For he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where the Lord was placed.
verses.textLa: non est hic: surrexit enim, sicut dixit. Venite, et videte locum, ubi positus erat Dominus.

verses.textEn: And then, go quickly, and tell his disciples that he has risen. And behold, he will precede you to Galilee. There you shall see him. Lo, I have told you beforehand.”
verses.textLa: Et cito euntes, dicite discipulis eius quia surrexit: et ecce præcedit vos in Galilæam: ibi eum videbitis. Ecce prædixi vobis.

verses.textEn: And they went out of the tomb quickly, with fear and in great joy, running to announce it to his disciples.
verses.textLa: Et exierunt cito de monumento cum timore, et gaudio magno, currentes nunciare discipulis eius.

verses.textEn: And behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Hail.” But they drew near and took hold of his feet, and they adored him.
verses.textLa: Et ecce Iesus occurrit illis, dicens: Avete. Illæ autem accesserunt, et tenuerunt pedes eius, et adoraverunt eum.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus said to them: “Do not be afraid. Go, announce it to my brothers, so that they may go to Galilee. There they shall see me.”
verses.textLa: Tunc ait illis Iesus: Nolite timere. Ite, nunciare fratribus meis ut eant in Galilæam; ibi me videbunt.

verses.textEn: And when they had departed, behold, some of the guards went into the city, and they reported to the leaders of the priests all that had happened.
verses.textLa: Quæ cum abiissent, ecce quidam de custodibus venerunt in civitatem, et nunciaverunt principibus sacerdotum omnia, quæ facta fuerant.

verses.textEn: And gathering together with the elders, having taken counsel, they gave an abundant sum of money to the soldiers,
verses.textLa: Et congregati cum senioribus consilio accepto, pecuniam copiosam dederunt militibus,

verses.textEn: saying: “Say that his disciples arrived at night and stole him away, while we were sleeping.
verses.textLa: dicentes: Dicite quia discipuli eius nocte venerunt, et furati sunt eum, nobis dormientibus.

verses.textEn: And if the procurator hears about this, we will persuade him, and we will protect you.”
verses.textLa: Et si hoc auditum fuerit a præside, nos suadebimus ei, et securos vos faciemus.

verses.textEn: Then, having accepted the money, they did as they were instructed. And this word has been spread among the Jews, even to this day.
verses.textLa: At illi accepta pecunia, fecerunt sicut erant edocti. Et divulgatum est verbum istud apud Iudæos, usque in hodiernum diem.

verses.textEn: Now the eleven disciples went on to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had appointed them.
verses.textLa: Undecim autem discipuli abierunt in Galilæam in montem, ubi consituerat illis Iesus.

verses.textEn: And, seeing him, they worshipped him, but certain ones doubted.
verses.textLa: Et videntes eum adoraverunt: quidam autem dubitaverunt.

verses.textEn: And Jesus, drawing near, spoke to them, saying: “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.
verses.textLa: Et accedens Iesus locutus est eis, dicens: Data est mihi omnis potestas in cælo, et in terra.

verses.textEn: Therefore, go forth and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
verses.textLa: Euntes ergo docete omnes gentes: baptizantes eos in nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti:

verses.textEn: teaching them to observe all that I have ever commanded you. And behold, I am with you always, even to the consummation of the age.”
verses.textLa: docentes eos servare omnia quæcumque mandavi vobis: et ecce ego vobiscum sum omnibus diebus, usque ad consummationem sæculi.
